input_text:
Job Title: F&SCM Senior Project Manager 

Location: United States

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Information Technology, Project Management

Description:
F&SCM - SENIOR Project Manager 
Western Computer is a Gold Certified Microsoft Partner who has provided almost four decades of software solutioning expertise to businesses in a wide range of industries and allowed enterprise operations to transform in response to shifts in business trends, technology and optimized implementation strategies.
Our teams are stacked with certified professionals supporting AX/D365 Teams consisting of WMS / Trade & Logistics and also our Finance & Supply Chain Mgmt. (D365 F&SCM), Microsoft Dynamics NAV/D365 Business Central (D365 BC), and CRM/D365 Customer Engagement (D365 CE) product offerings.
The F&SCM - Senior Project Manager will lead the successful delivery of Dynamics 365 | Finance and Supply Chain Management (F&SCM) implementation and related projects, and ensure that the scope, resources and budget constraints are balanced. The PM is responsible for creating the project management plan -as well as coordinating with the project SA to ensure that the team is executing to the plan in order to complete the project successfully by achieving the project goals within the established scope, schedule, budget, and quality, with a high degree of customer satisfaction.
General Responsibilities: Project planning and execution, issue and risk management, stakeholder management, and developing and delivering effective communication.Provide excellent service and build ongoing relationships with clients, always showing up with the highest degree of integrity.Provide guidance and support to your project teams, while mentoring up and coming team membersCoordinate with project SA’s to ensure Design and team member tasks are properly engaged to provide the expected solution.Work with our sales team to identify and cultivate opportunities and provide direction during the sales cycle.Define project scope, goals and deliverables that support our client's business goals while cultivating a trusting relationship with each client.Understand client's resource capabilities and constraints and adjust the project plan accordingly.Develop and successfully deliver large scale projects activities including but not limited to scheduling, resourcing, backlog management, and proposal development.Co-Manage team activities and project dependencies to ensure on time project deliverables.Organize and facilitate steering committee meetings, project planning meetings, and recurring team meetings.Lead and ensure the delivery team is practicing the - implementation methodology including continuous improvement activities and change management.Manage issues and escalations on projects, always demonstrating empathy and strong interpersonal skills.Plan and schedule consultants' work and negotiating resolution to resourcing conflicts.Work collaboratively with project teams and clients, including traveling to their locations.Set aside time for self-development by attending training or self-learning on key subjects, always striving to be your best self.Contribute to organizational growth and improvement through collaborative process refinement initiatives with other Project Managers and other disciplines within the organization.
Qualifications: Proven experience leading successful full lifecycle Dynamics ERP Implementations (D365 F&SCM)Great leadership and communication skills5+ years of direct work experience in a project management capacity including all aspects of process development and project lifecycle execution.Experience mentoring fellow teammates and/or project management peers.PMP, CSM, or CAPM designation preferred.Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Business, Computer Science or related field.Strong technical aptitudeSolid interpersonal skills, and ability to establish and maintain effective working relationships within and outside WC.Ability to work primarily independently and concurrently manage multiple projects.Ability to work collaboratively for the best interests of the business and the team.Ability to communicate effectively in both spoken and written English.
Requirements: Bachelor’s or master's preferred, or equivalent work experience.3 years of Project Management Oversight for implementations (minimum)5 years or more experience with Microsoft Dynamics (at least 3 years focused on Finance & Supply Chain Mgmt. (D365 F& SCM)Proficient in Microsoft ProjectStrong communication and presentation skillsAbility to work in a high-paced environment and manage multiple projects.Ability to travel from 25% to 50% to client sites.Remote work
The Perks:  Competitive Compensation: Anticipate a competitive salary ranging from $145,000 to $180,000 per year with an opportunity for bonus.Comprehensive Healthcare Coverage: Rest easy with access to thorough healthcare coverage for you and your family. As part of our commitment to our team, we cover the costs of your medical benefits. Financial Planning with a 401(k): Secure your financial future with our accessible 401(k)-retirement plan. We're here to support you in building a solid foundation for your financial well-being. Work-Life Balance: Recognizing the importance of downtime, we offer ample paid time off for vacations, holidays, and the occasional sick day. We understand the value of working hard and encourage you to take time to recharge. Remote Work Flexibility: Experience the flexibility of working remotely from a location that suits you best. We believe in providing you with the freedom to choose where you work.  Who we are: We have been on an exciting mission since 1987 to partner with customers as they transform and grow their businesses. As a Microsoft Solution Partner, we are recognized as a top partner. We owe that success to our team of 150+ Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform solutions experts who pair business needs with system capabilities to create the recipe for success. We are continuously innovating to maximize our customers’ technology investments. From our IP products to our teams who always have a little fun, we are not your average ERP company.  We encourage you to apply even if you feel that you do not meet all of the above qualifications. Frequently cited statistics show that women and underrepresented groups are more likely to only apply to jobs if they meet 100% of the listed qualifications. Western Computer encourages you to break that statistic and to apply. No one ever meets 100% of the requirements. We look forward to your application!

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.title: F&SCM Senior Project Manager
output_json.summary: Lead successful implementation of Dynamics 365 | Finance and Supply Chain Management projects.
preferred_degrees: Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Business, Computer Science or related field
required_skills: Proven experience leading successful full lifecycle Dynamics ERP Implementations (D365 F&SCM)
Experience mentoring fellow teammates and/or project management peers
PMP, CSM, or CAPM designation preferred
Ability to concurrently manage multiple projects
Ability to communicate effectively in both spoken and written English
optional_skills: Bachelor’s or master's preferred, or equivalent work experience
3 years of Project Management Oversight for implementations
5 years or more experience with Microsoft Dynamics (at least 3 years focused on Finance & Supply Chain Mgmt. (D365 F& SCM))
Ability to work in a high-paced environment
Ability to travel from 25% to 50% to client sites
tools_and_technologies: Microsoft Dynamics NAV/D365 Business Central (D365 BC)
job_responsibilities: Guidance and support to project teams
Mentorship of up and coming team members
Ensuring design and team member tasks
Defining project scope, goals, and deliverables
Understanding client's resource capabilities and constraints
Managing team activities and project dependencies
Collaboration with project teams and clients
benefits: Competitive Compensation: $145,000 to $180,000 per year with an opportunity for bonus
Work-Life Balance: Paid time off for vacations, holidays, and sick days
output_json.company_information: Western Computer is a Gold Certified Microsoft Partner with over 35 years of experience in software solutions for various industries. They specialize in Microsoft Dynamics 365 and Power Platform solutions.
output_json.equal_opportunity_policy: We encourage applications from all qualified individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, or veteran status.

other.content: Competitive Compensation, Comprehensive Healthcare Coverage, Financial Planning with a 401(k)-retirement plan, Work-Life Balance, Remote Work Flexibility
